org.radarbase.oauth

Class OAuth2Client

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.radarbase.oauth.OAuth2Client

  • public class OAuth2Client
extends java.lang.Object
    Class for handling OAuth2 client credentials grant with the RADAR platform's ManagementPortal.

    Although it is designed with the ManagementPortal in mind, any identity server based on the Spring OAuth library and using JWT as a token should be compatible. The getValidToken() method provides access to the OAuth2AccessTokenDetails instance, and will request a new access token if the current one is expired. It will throw a TokenException if anything went wrong. So to get the actual token you will call client.getAccessToken().getAccessToken(). This token is in JWT format and can be parsed by a JWT library of your preference. Note: by default, the public key endpoint on ManagementPortal is located at /oauth/token_key.

    See the test cases for this class for examples on usage. Also see OAuth2AccessTokenDetails for more info on how to use it.

    This class is thread-safe.

      • getValidToken

        public OAuth2AccessTokenDetails getValidToken()
                                       throws TokenException
        Get the access token. This method will automatically request a new access token if the current one will expire before 10 seconds.
        Returns:
        the access token
        Throws:
        TokenException - if a new access token could not be fetched

      • getValidToken

        public OAuth2AccessTokenDetails getValidToken(java.time.Duration validity)
                                       throws TokenException
        Get the access token. This method will automatically request a new access token if the current one will expire before given validity duration.
        Parameters:
        validity - time until the current token will become invalid
        Returns:
        the access token
        Throws:
        TokenException - if a new access token could not be fetched

      • isTokenValidFor

        public boolean isTokenValidFor(java.time.Duration timeStillValid)
        Check whether given token is still valid for the given amount of time.
        Parameters:
        timeStillValid - duration that the token should still be valid.
        Returns:
        true if the token is valid for given duration, false otherwise.

      • refreshToken

        public OAuth2AccessTokenDetails refreshToken()
                                      throws TokenException
        Refresh the current token. This will update the token value of this class.
        Returns:
        the new refreshed token
        Throws:
        TokenException - if the token could not be refreshed.
